[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Key: StateKvCommitProgress] [State store synchronization] If StateKvCommitProgress updates are not properly synchronized with actual StateKvDb writes, can queries see inconsistent state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Key: StateMerkleCommitProgress] [Merkle tree synchronization] Can StateMerkleCommitProgress updates lag behind actual Merkle tree updates, causing state root mismatches during consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Key: OverallCommitProgress] [Restore interaction] During state restoration using StateSnapshotKvRestoreProgress, can OverallCommitProgress be incorrectly updated, causing the restored database to appear more or less complete than it actually is? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Memory exhaustion] Can deserializing extremely large StateSnapshotProgress values cause out-of-memory conditions, enabling DoS attacks against validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Vector allocation] Does encode_key() properly handle allocation failures when creating the Vec<u8> for large keys, or can OOM cause panics? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Enum: DbMetadataKey] [Key proliferation] Can attackers create unbounded numbers of shard-specific keys (e.g., StateMerkleShardRestoreProgress(shard, version)) to exhaust database capacity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Value: StateSnapshotProgress] [Hash collision] If StateSnapshotProgress stores key_hash values, can hash collisions cause restoration to skip or misprocess state chunks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Schema: DbMetadataSchema] [No integrity protection] Are metadata values authenticated or checksummed, or can silent corruption of metadata go undetected until causing critical failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [No encryption] Are sensitive metadata values (if any exist) encrypted at rest, or are all metadata values stored in plaintext? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Key: EpochEndingStateMerklePrunerProgress] [Epoch boundary] Can pruning epoch-ending state prematurely cause validators to lose critical reconfiguration data needed for the next epoch? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Key: EpochEndingStateMerkleShardPrunerProgress(ShardId)] [Cross-epoch consistency] Can inconsistent pruning of epoch-ending state across shards cause some validators to successfully reconfigure while others fail? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Schema: DbMetadataSchema] [Missing metrics] Are there metrics or logs tracking metadata updates, or can malicious or buggy metadata modifications occur silently without detection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Function: expect_version()] [Error reporting] When expect_version() panics due to variant mismatch, is the panic message sufficient to debug which component wrote the wrong variant type? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Enum: DbMetadataKey] [Key removal] If deprecated keys like LedgerMetadataDbProgress are removed in future versions, can old databases with those keys still be read without causing decode errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/db_metadata/mod.rs] [Value: DbMetadataValue] [Version addition] If Version(Version) needs to store additional metadata in the future, can the schema evolve without breaking existing databases? (Medium)
